intro: Calyptranthes ramiflora, commonly known as the ramiflorous calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters along the branches. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Calyptranthes ramiflora is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
